SENT.plain: Lateral sinus thrombosis, a frequent complication of ear infections in preantibiotic days, is seldom seen today
When it does occur, it is usually in a patient with a known history of a chronic ear infection
Two patients are described with septic pulmonary emboli from inapparent lateral sinus thrombosis
Lateral sinus thrombosis should be suspected in any patient with chills, fever, neck pain, and septic pulmonary emboli
